intro: Tithymalus seguierianus subsp. loiseleurii, commonly known as the Loiseleur's tithymalus, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branched stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in flat-topped clusters, and it blooms during the cooler months. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, peppery scent when crushed.
